intro: Bystropogon maderensis var. genuinus, commonly known as the Madeiran starflower, is a rare endemic species native to the Azores. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its star-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in the unique microclimates of its native habitat. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
